intro: Dudleya bryceae, commonly known as the Bryce Canyon Dudleya, is a species of flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, typically in spring. It is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soil with minimal water. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and succulent collections.
